This is a port town, particularly for the fishing industry and is the nearest town of any size to
. The latter is main reason any visitor comes here as there is little else of interest. The park is sometimes day tripped from an accommodation base at Probolinggo.
take around two hours as do those from

.

Be sure to go all the way to the main bus terminal, 6 km southwest of the centre, instead of getting dropped off at some travel agent (who will pay the driver a commission).  Minibuses to Cemoro Lawang, the nearest settlement to

leave from the terminal and take about an hour and a half.  Purchase any tickets directly at the bus terminal, as the local travel agents are notoriously mercenary and will happily charge you multiples of the real price and/or fake return tickets.

value: directions=5km east of the village of Kraksaan, nr Probolinggo
content=A restored Buddhist temple which dates from 1354 and which is mentioned as one of the places visited mighty King Hayam Wuruk in 1359.

content=Very popular with budget travellers heading to Bromo-Semeru. Has a range of accommodation but all of it is clean, if basic.
content=Mid range hotel with a nice pool and 24 hr restaurant.
